First off, this place is beautiful.  Who knew an old parking garage could be transformed into such a magnificent space?  Really - Wow!  Of the four restaurants housed in this cavernous food palace, we tried the Taperia.  Servers come around bearing plates of tapas - seafood, stews, potatoes, paellas... We were really hoping to get more egg dishes, but only one came around during the 90 minutes we were there.  The desserts didn't seem all that great, so we skipped it.  Do visit the bathroom so you can see the photos of before and after.  I could imagine coming here for drinks every now and again - just to soak up the atmosphere.  Though everyone seems to be taking selfies here.  that could make for a fun drinking game.  On second though, you'd be soused within 5 minutes... ok no drinking game to the selfies being taken.  perhaps I'll try one of the other restaurants.  The taperia was ok, but I wouldn't eat there again.
